channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL

item.title: Report E-2025050462
item.description:
Report E-2025050462

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: HUNTSVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 20, 2025, one (1) 40-pound bag of sodium carbonate peroxyhydrate was forked and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Remediation Consultants (ERC) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the released product from the surfaces. All collected product, the damaged bag, and impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050216
item.description:
Report E-2025050216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-08
  • City: ATHENS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver noticed dripping from the bottom valve of a tote in transit. The driver attempted to isolate the leak by using plug n dike. A spill response contractor was called. The spill response contractor transferred the contents of the tote with the leaking valve, into another tote. The spill response contractor also cleaned up the material that leaked from the bottom valve of the tote. In total, 22 pounds of product leaked from the bottom valve on the tote. Only a small amount of material leaked out from the trailer, majority of the material was contained to the trailer. The location of incident listed in #7 was the closest address to where the leak occurred, so that is why it was used as the location of the incident.
